Posts.Content: corgigirl wrote: Does anyone else have a half dollar sized hard place that feels very boney because it is a bone - a rib that juts out along scar line? It's uncomfortable and not too sightly but like every thing else, I've come to like it. Love will take a while. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Rib sticking out after mastectomy corgigirl LindaLou53

Posts.Content: May 13, 2007 11:30AM corgigirl wrote: Thank you for responding. My gyn and plastic surgeon sent me to the surgeon to find out what the hard, bone like thing was to make sure it wasn't a new growth. Surgeon said the bone like thing was indeed a bone - it is one of my ribs and not enough skin was put around it so it literally sticks out.
Posts.Title: Rib sticking out after mastectomy corgigirl LindaLou53

Posts.Content: May 14, 2007 10:23AM corgigirl wrote: Mine is on the right side also. The right side had a lumpectomy and radiation and then was part of a prophlactic mast. after cancer found in the left breast 11 months later and both breasts were removed. I had immediate reconstruction that failed because of infections on both sides. I then joined the no reconstruction side of the world. In the fall, the plastic surgeon will go in and smooth out everything and hopefully add some extra skin over the rib. I don't wear anything tight as it would show. The whole process soured me on reconstruction and I feel like young girl again just going without. I don't wear a bra just looser things and don't feel self conscious at all.
Posts.Title: Rib sticking out after mastectomy corgigirl LindaLou53

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2008 11:23PM corgigirl wrote: Resident of San Mateo, Contra Costa and Alameda Counties at different times and diagnosed in 2006 and again in 2007 (double mastectemy in 07).  Non smoker, never drank and mom to 2 kids (and had them when I was young) and a professional woman.  I joke with other professional women that it was the photocopy machine that we all used to excess - but I have no idea why.  Good idea to see what Bay Area women have in common and especially women in Marin.
Posts.Title: Marin County BC Ladies out there? jobu Melanie53

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2010 07:31AM corgigirl wrote: Rather than put up with these procedures and the radiation have chosen not to fly anywhere ever again.  Luckily, I like to drive.  Worry that my children will also stop flying and they live quite a ways away.  Understand why they do it, just do not want to be put in that position.
Posts.Title: Full body scanners and foobs OLBinNJ Leah_S
